history.content: What major does your cal central say? If it's CS, your enrollment priority for CS courses is fine :)

children.subject:
Sorry, I'm a little confused about what you have done, so I'll cover all the steps. You won't actually be declared in your second major until you: 

  1. Complete the packet
  2. Meet with a major adviser from each department. Each department will need to sign it and then approve an online code. You should schedule an appt with a CS major adviser via CalCentral, or go to Wednesday drop-in hours
  3. Turn the form (with all signatures) into 206 Evans Hall
  4. Wait ~2 weeks for them to process it.

Sorry about the confusion. I applied for the cs major last december and was accepted in january. In the application I specified that I would be double majoring, but I hadn't declared the other major at that point. I applied for the second major in January and was accepted in February, but for some reason, on calcentral, my only major displayed is the second major. Could this be fixed somehow? My cs enrollment priority is much more important to me than my other major, and it was my first major declared. Thank you!

Ok, I've done some serious detective work and have figured out what happened, routed back in confusion about you listing yourself as a double major on the application.The quickest way to fix this is to get the double major approved. (a change of major to just CS would take just as long). It looks like Econ has already signed your DM packet. Has a CS Advisor? If not, email me a copy at nicolemcintyre@berkeley.edu and I'll review/sign/return it. 

I'm working from Sacramento so not able to do it in person.
Thank you so much for your time! I've emailed you my double major paperwork.

It says my major is only my other major, and I think it said that in my admission to cs application it won't show up in calcentral until I finish the paperwork. In the major application it said I could directly submit the double major form without the cs signature, would that still be possible?

history.content: Hi, I was admitted to the cs major in January, but I put in my application that I would be a double major. I didn't declare the second major until recently, and don't have the signature from the cs department yet to finish processing the paperwork. Will this affect my ability to enroll with cs major priority? If so, is there any way to get around this? Thank you!
history.subject: Enrolling without double major paperwork completed
